name: Parkview Hotel

reviews.title: Nicely Elegant
reviews.text: Our room was very nice - tasteful decorating, extremely CLEAN, and lots of space; two big beds with down-filled comforters, big closet. Mini-fridge and coffee-maker, iron, hair dryer, flat-screen TV. Bathroom was big enough, double-head shower, extra towels. We called down to ask for extra coffee packets, and it was delivered up to us within a few minutes. We asked at the front desk about getting a ride to Armory Square to go to Irish bars, and the desk person immediately got the shuttle driver to take us. The shuttle driver told us which places to go, and even gave us a phone number for the best taxi service to use to return to the hotel as he would be off duty when we wanted to return (late at night!) Check-in and check-out each took about 3 minutes. Lobby is very pretty - TV, fireplace, comfy couch, and free internet to check e-mails. Parking was easy (and free) and close to every place that we wanted to go. I would stay here again - just very charming and comfortable.

reviews.title: Why is this hotel in Syracuse????
reviews.text: What a wonderful surprise for such a dreadful city!!! We were visiting SUNY ESF and booked one night at the Parkview and wow were we impressed. Great big rooms, we were upgraded for free to a suite with a huge king size bed, duvet comforters and featherbeds, wonderful 2 person shower with 2 shower heads, flat screen TV and to boot, a wonderful cafe located inside the hotel that served all fair trade and organice coffees and teas! If only it were in a better city we would stay all the time. Best hotel experience!!!

reviews.title: The BEST!
reviews.text: This hotel was a wonderful retreat. Clean. Great service. Beautiful big room with view of a park across the street. The restaurant served great food and reasonable prices. A great value! Very comfortable bed. Highly recommended.

While obviously renovated, you get a great room for a good price. The minor problems we had were fixed by the staff the next day. The room and bath were very clean, and the king-size bed was very comfortable. A better hotel for the same price as the available budget motels. We would stay again.
reviews.title: Good Choice for Location & Price
Grand Old Hotel
reviews.text: I was looking for a hotel in Syracuse, not far off of I-81, to stop and spend a few days on our way back to NJ from Montreal. Our plan was to spend some time wondering the wine trails in the Finger Lakes. I came across this hotel while searching the web. What a pleasant surprise! The location was right off of the highway, with a lovely park directly across the street. Not really a walking around type of neighbor, but safe. The hotel is old and has been renovated leaving some of the old characteristics in place adding to its charm.

reviews.title: Are we talking about the same hotel?
reviews.text: If you're looking for slick and modern, this isn't it - although our spacious room did have free wireless internet and a flat panel TV! Our bed was comfortable and the shower was great - a dual shower head! We had an iron AND ironing board in our room, along with a mini-fridge and coffemaker. There is a small cafe off the lobby which serves all sorts of beverages, including beer and wine. They offer light meals and are opened until 10:00pm. The staff was friendly and very helpful with directions. Plenty of free parking available. All in all a great value in a convenient location.
I stayed here for one night over the Memorial Day weekend while visiting family in the area.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel

reviews.text: This is a decent hotel, not outstanding but fine as a place to sleep if you’re going to be out and about in Syracuse! Most importantly (for me anyway), it was very clean. Although I booked a standard room I was upgraded to a junior suite. The suite was big, and had a kitchen area with a fridge, sink, microwave, stove, coffee maker, toaster and utensils – all of which looked new. The kitchen was against one wall of the room and behind a set of sliding doors which looked like a closet, much nicer than having an exposed kitchen in the middle of the room!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel - We'll be back!
Great room, clean, friendly service
reviews.text: The best part of the room was the bathroom, which also looked brand new, had a double shower head and was spotlessly clean. The bedroom itself was a little dark and seemed dated, as did the corridors and the other communal areas of the hotel. There was also a bit of a musty smell permeating the whole hotel and my room, but then I do have a very keen sense of smell and this might not bother other people as it did me!
Be aware that there is no room service in the hotel, but there is a café off the lobby which closes at 9pm or 10pm. Unfortunately for me I arrived at the hotel at 10.05pm.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, excellent value
Great Hotel
reviews.text: I only dealt with the staff during check in and check out, but they seemed very nice and friendly.

description: Complete Property Upgrade Complete as of March 1, 2013! Hot breakfast now included!Chic downtown Syracuse NY hotel. Those three words just go together, don't they? Here are three more words: The Parkview Hotel. This is contemporary meets art-deco; funky meets comfortable, and the end result is a boutique hotel atmosphere where you feel just fine about kicking off your shoes and relaxing. Once you check in, you're not going to want to leave any time soon. All rooms and suites are equipped with complimentary upgraded WIFI internet access, speaker phones with voicemail, digital cable, flat-screen LCD televisions, and a really comfortable bed! Just completed, new in-room window treatments, ergonomic chairs and bedding package.
